newsitem.title: USA: IMF, DONORS TO MEET AUG 11 ON THAI FINANCE PACKAGE.
newsitem.headline: IMF, DONORS TO MEET AUG 11 ON THAI FINANCE PACKAGE.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund said on Thursday that lender states and institutions would meet in Tokyo on August 11 to discuss a possible financial aid package for Thailand.

"The International Monetary Fund has convened a meeting of a number of interested countries and multilateral institutions in Tokyo on Monday August 11 to discuss their possible participation in a financing package for Thailand to support the stabilization program now being discussed," a statement said.

Monetary sources in Washington declined to comment on the size of a possible aid package for Thailand, which sought IMF help reluctantly this week after weeks of procrastination following a currency crash.

Sources in the Thai finance ministry said earlier on Thursday that Thailand was likely to seek $7 billion from Japan, $4 billion from the IMF, $1 billion from the World Bank and $1 billion from the Asian Development Bank.
It would be the biggest funding package for a single country since Mexico received a multi-billion dollar bailout in 1995.

IMF Managing Director Michel Camdessus has already said that the fund was working with the Thai authorties to transform the current stabilization program into a long-term adjustment program which could win IMF financial support.
